subject: Investing
title: What Is a Blockchain?
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is a Blockchain?.

hook.text: Imagine a notebook that thousands of strangers share, yet nobody can erase a single line from it.

buildup.text: A blockchain is a distributed ledger where every transaction is recorded across a network of computers.

discovery.text: Each block contains a batch of transactions plus a cryptographic link to the previous block.

twist.text: Altering one block would require re-computing every block after itâ€”across thousands of machines simultaneously.

climax.text: This design makes blockchains nearly tamper-proof without needing a central authority like a bank.

punchline.text: A blockchain is trust built with math instead of middlemen.

quiz.question: What makes a blockchain tamper-resistant?
options: Each block is cryptographically linked to the previous one
Only one computer stores the data
